tasks.task: Analyze and discuss the relationship between advance time infiltration and depo collation in furrow irrigation systems.
subtasks: Explain the Caustico relationship and its use in determining the infiltration depth with respect to opportunity time.
Derive the infiltration opportunity time (T) from absorbed infiltration data for the specific soil type.
Make assumptions for uniform soil and uniform initial moisture content.
Consider the distance (Z) from the soil surface as a function of depth and apply the Kostikov equation (Ct^α) with alpha as an empirical constant.
Analyze the time required for water to advance to the downstream end (Tt) compared to the net irrigation time (Tn), using an assumption of Tt being one-fourth of Tn.
Break down the total infiltration time (Tn) into intervals (δT1, δT2, ..., δT4) and calculate the incremental depth of water infiltration (δZ1, δZ2, ..., δZ4) in each interval.
Derive the formula for the average deep percolation loss (delta Z5 / 2) and the total average wet depth (Z4 + Z5 / 2).
Understand the role of the fractional advance ratio (FAR) in balancing net irrigation depth and deep percolation.
Refer to tables or guidelines like those from international organizations for typical ranges of deep percolation losses based on soil type (alpha) and FAR ratio.
Discuss the importance of considering local climate, rainfall intensity, and existing field grades when selecting irrigation parameters to prevent erosion.
Mention the use of evaluation runs to empirically determine limiting stream sizes and erosion thresholds for specific soil and slope conditions.
